entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying

Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India

Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Girl Child Attend Her Age of 18
fields.briefDescription: The Financial Assistance for Girl Child Attend Her Age of 18 scheme provides financial assistance in the form of a fixed deposit of ₹1,00,000/- for each female child of a registered worker or spouse who has undergone a family planning operation after the birth of one female child.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Funeral Expenses (JKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The “Financial Assistance for Funeral Expenses” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu and Kashmir, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to the nominees of a deceased registered member for covering funeral expenses.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Natural Death
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Natural Death” was launched by the Maharashtra Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra. Under the scheme, the Board provides financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- to the legal heir of a registered worker who dies.

fields.schemeName: Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course
fields.briefDescription: The Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course scheme was launched by the Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra.

fields.schemeName: Schooling Education (JKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Schooling Education" by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Dept., J&K, provides financial assistance for the education of children of registered construction workers, from Class Nursery/1st to 5th, and from Class 6th to 8th.

fields.schemeName: Large Sized Multi Purpose Coop. Society For Interest Free Loan
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides interest-free loans to citizens through a cooperative society. The maximum loan amount offered is ₹45,000/-, with zero interest charged.

fields.schemeName: Employees Cooperative Societies Surety Loan
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides loans up to ₹1,50,000/- at an interest rate of 14%. It is aimed at assisting citizens by offering financial support through surety loans from the Employees Cooperative Societies.

fields.schemeName: District Central Cooperative Banks and through its Branches: For Revamped Micro Credit Loan for Women Vendors of Flower, Vegetable, Fruit etc.
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides revamped micro credit loans through District Central Cooperative Banks to support women vendors selling flowers, vegetables, fruits etc. Loans range from  ₹100/- to  ₹5,000/- with an interest rate of 11%.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Poultry Development
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers loans to farmers for poultry development and cattle development, with funding of up to ₹14,800/- for 200 birds or ₹17,000/- for 2 cows, with an interest rate of 14.5% to 16.5%.

fields.schemeName: Goat Unit Scheme On Grants And Bank Loans
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial support through grants and bank loans to farmers to purchase (10+1) goat units for milk and meat production. The scheme covers a 40% subsidy for general applicants and 60% for SC/ST beneficiaries, based on a total unit cost of ₹77,456/-.

fields.schemeName: Incentive given to Encourage Inter caste Marriages
fields.briefDescription: The "Incentive for Encouraging Inter-Caste Marriages" scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra, and funded jointly by the State and Central Government (50:50). The scheme provides financial incentives to support inter-caste marriages.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension" is a social welfare scheme by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra. In this scheme, ₹600 per month is provided to elderly individuals aged 65 years and above from BPL families.

fields.schemeName: Fal Podharopan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to expand the area under fruit plantation in the district and increase the fruit production. This scheme is implemented in all the 52 districts of the state.

fields.schemeName: Vasantrao Naik Tanda / Basti Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Vasantrao Naik Tanda/Basti Development" is implemented by the Govt. of Maharashtra. The scheme provides essential amenities to the Tandas and Bastis of Vimukta Jatis and Nomadic Tribes. The scheme focuses on improving access to drinking water, electrification, latrines, drainage, etc.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Jammu and Kashmir)
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 15th August 1995, the "Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme"is a pension scheme by the Department Of Social Welfare  Jammu and Kashmir. In this scheme, a pension of ₹1000/- is provided to differently-abled individuals from 'Below Poverty Line'.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: Jewel Loans
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers jewel loans to farmers, enabling them to access up to ₹2,00,000/- at an interest rate of 11.5% for agricultural purposes.

fields.schemeName: Incentive For The Simple Marriage (Scheduled Tribe)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Incentive for the Simple Marriage" was launched by the Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka. The scheme provides an incentive of ₹50,000/- to ST individuals residing in Karnataka who marry another ST individual on or after 11th August 2015.

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance Scheme (Madhya Pradesh)
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 13th August 2013, the "Funeral Assistance Scheme" by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Govt. Madhya Pradesh provides ₹3,000/- for the last rites of destitute or unclaimed bodies.  The scheme also supports families registered under labour schemes.

fields.schemeName: State Disability Pension
fields.briefDescription: The Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Mizoram launched the State Disability Pension scheme. It provides a monthly pension of ₹350 to 200 eligible individuals who are completely blind or bedridden.

fields.schemeName: State Senior Citizens Home
fields.briefDescription: The Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Mizoram launched the State Senior Citizens Home for the homeless aged persons. It provides shelter and facilities to homeless elderly individuals aged 60 and above, who lack family support.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Iron Boxes at Free of Cost
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides complimentary iron boxes to support individuals from Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNCs) engaged in washing work, aiming to improve their livelihood.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Bagwani Mission: Strawberry Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote strawberry cultivation across 20 districts in Bihar. It provides subsidies on seedlings, packaging materials, and equipment to support farmers in enhancing strawberry production.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Bagwani Mission: Aam Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme aims to expand plantain cultivation across all districts in Bihar. Farmers can receive subsidies for up to 10 acres and access high-quality tissue-cultured plants for cultivation.

fields.schemeName: Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojana - Jharkhand
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojana" aims to provide industry-relevant skill development training for youth in Jharkhand, aligning with NSQF standards. Implemented by Jharkhand Skill Development Mission Society (JSDMS) across all 24 districts, it offers free training to enhance employability.

fields.schemeName: Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana: Medical Assistance for Incurable Diseases
fields.briefDescription: “Medical Assistance for Incurable Diseases” under the “Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana” by the Labour Resources Dept., provides financial assistance ranging from ₹7,500/- to ₹30,000/- to workers or craftsmen suffering from incurable diseases.

fields.schemeName: Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana: Accidental Death
fields.briefDescription: The component “Accidental Death” under the “Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana” launched by the Labour Resources Department, Bihar, provides financial assistance of ₹1,00,000/- to the families of workers or craftsmen in case of accidental death.

fields.schemeName: Burial and Ex-gratia Payment Scheme in Case of Death of Unregistered Laborer During Work at Construction Site
fields.briefDescription: Launched in 2014, the "Funeral and Ex-gratia Payment Scheme for Unregistered Laborers" is a welfare scheme by the M.P. Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Government of Madhya Pradesh, providing funeral assistance and ex-gratia payments in case of death or permanent disability.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Housing (Rural) Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Launched in 2013, the "Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Housing (Rural) Scheme" provides permanent houses to registered construction workers in rural areas of Madhya Pradesh.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Support Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The "Maternity Support Scheme" by the MPBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh provides an amount of ₹16,000/- as maternity allowance, payable in two installments.

fields.schemeName: Senior Hostel (Scheduled Tribes)
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 1st January 1966, the scheme "Senior Hostel (Scheduled Tribes)" by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh provides free accommodation and mess facilities to students from studying in Class 9th to 12th in a government/recognized school.

fields.schemeName: "Rent Subsidy" under "Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Industries"
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to support SC/ST and women entrepreneurs who have initiated production on or after 27-3-2002 in a rented building. It provides rent subsidy for the first five years from the commencement of commercial production on a tapering basis, with a max ceiling of ₹5,000 per month.

fields.schemeName: Jharkhand State Backward Classes Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Jharkhand State Backward Classes Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme" aims to enhance educational opportunities and participation among students belonging to backward classes in Jharkhand. It provides financial assistance to reduce dropout rates from classes 1 to 10 and promote equality in education.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Drought Relief Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Chief Minister Drought Relief Scheme aims to provide relief and financial assistance to families affected by drought in designated areas. The scheme ensures financial security, livelihood support, and basic resources for drought-hit communities.

fields.schemeName: Cash Award to Top Ranking Holders in Public Examinations
fields.briefDescription: Through the "Cash Award to Top Ranking Holders in Public Examinations" scheme, cash awards of ₹50,000/-, ₹30,000/- and ₹20,000/- are granted to the 1st, 2nd and 3rd Rank Holders respectively from SSLC/ SSC/ HSC Exam, and Intermediate (2nd Year) Public Examinations.

fields.schemeName: Ashram Schools (Scheduled Tribes)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Ashram Schools" was launched on 1st January 1966 by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme provides free accommodation, mess, and education facilities to Scheduled Tribe students.

fields.schemeName: Free Distribution of Text Books to Students
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 1st January 2008, the scheme "Free Distribution of Textbooks to Students" by the School Education Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides free textbooks to students studying in classes 9th to 12th in government schools.

fields.schemeName: Gaushala Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This initiative provides financial assistance to registered gaushalas for building permanent infrastructure. Under this scheme, up to ₹10,000,00/- can be provided, with 90% of the funding from the state government and 10% contributed by the gaushala.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Yuva Udyami Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This is a flagship scheme of the Bihar government aimed at promoting entrepreneurship and self-employment among the youth by providing financial assistance of up to ₹10,00,000/- for setting up businesses.

fields.schemeName: Issuance of Free House Sites
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free residential land sites to eligible individuals from the Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) who do not own a house or land, helping them secure housing stability.

fields.schemeName: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme-Bihar
fields.briefDescription: The “Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme-Bihar” aims to provide financial assistance to eligible students from Extremely Backward Classes (EBC) and Other Backward Classes (OBC) for their post-secondary education.

fields.schemeName: Interim Relief to the Beneficiaries Affected by Disaster (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Through "Interim Relief to the Beneficiaries Affected by Disaster (GBOCWWB)" , the beneficiaries of the Board who are affected by disasters, catastrophes or natural calamities are extended immediate relief of up to ₹10,00,000/-. This shall include cash payment to beneficiaries of the affected area.

fields.schemeName: Shaheed Gram Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Shaheed Gram Vikas Yojana" by the Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to develop villages linked to tribal freedom fighters. It provides housing, infrastructure, and other facilities to eligible Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes.

fields.schemeName: Jharkhand Sports Excellence Cash Award Scheme to Players
fields.briefDescription: The “Jharkhand Sports Excellence Cash Award Scheme to Players” aims to provide cash awards to athletes for exceptional achievements in national and international competitions, as per the Jharkhand Sports Policy, 2022.

fields.schemeName: Backward Class Students Meritorious Award Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Backward Classes Student Merit Award Scheme" aims to recognize and reward academic excellence among backward-class students. Monetary awards are provided to one boy and one girl student from backward classes who secure the highest marks at the district level in class 10th and 12th board exams.

fields.schemeName: Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The “Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme” aims to provide financial support to retired athletes for their lifelong contribution to sports. Athletes, including Arjuna, Dronacharya, and Dhyan Chand awardees, Olympic participants, and Commonwealth or Asian Games medalists, receive a monthly pension.

fields.schemeName: Madhya Pradesh Professional Talent Examination Award Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "M.P. Professional Talent Examination Award Scheme" aims to recognize and reward backward-class students who excel in professional entrance examinations. Monetary awards are provided to backward-class students who secure the top three positions in entrance examinations like PET, PPT, and MCA.

fields.schemeName: Aahar Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Aahar Anudan Yojana" provides monthly assistance of ₹1,000 to students, girls, and women from backward tribes like Baiga, Bharia, and Saharia. The scheme aims to combat malnutrition among special tribal families by ensuring access to nutritious food through financial assistance.

fields.schemeName: Poshan Sudha
fields.briefDescription: This scheme is a government initiative to provide nutrition and healthcare support to pregnant and lactating mothers in tribal districts of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Satat Jeevikoparjan Yojana (SJY)
fields.briefDescription: "Satat Jeevikoparjan Yojana (SJY)" is a flagship program launched by the Government of Bihar to uplift ultra-poor households through comprehensive livelihood support, skill-building, and financial inclusion.

fields.schemeName: Production Linked Incentive Scheme (PLI) For Promoting Telecom & Networking Products Manufacturing In India
fields.briefDescription: Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme aims to boost domestic manufacturing, investments and export in the telecom and networking products The PLI Scheme will be implemented within the overall financial limits of ₹ 12,195 Crores only (Rupees Twelve Thousand One Hundred and Ninety-Five Crore only)

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojna (PMFBY)
fields.briefDescription: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana was launched in  2016 with the aim to support farmers by providing an affordable comprehensive risk cover for crops.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: National Agriculture Insurance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The National Agriculture Insurance Scheme (NAIS) was introduced by the Government of India to provide comprehensive insurance coverage and financial support to farmers against crop losses due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.

fields.schemeName: Free Employment Oriented Training to Educated Unemployed Youth of Backward Class and Minority Class
fields.briefDescription: "Free Employment Oriented Training to Educated Unemployed Youth of Backward Class and Minority Class" aims to provide quality pre-examination training for various employment-oriented competitive examinations to talented but economically disadvantaged young men and women.

fields.schemeName: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana (AABY) is a social security scheme for rural landless households implemented by the Ministry of Labour & Employment, Government of India. The scheme provides insurance coverage to the head of the household or an earning member of the family in the age group of 18 to 59.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Assistance for Interest Subsidy to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise (Manufacturing Sector)
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Financial Support to MSMEs in ZED Certification
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Net SGST reimbursement to Micro, Small and Medium Manufacturing Enterprise (MSMEs):
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

fields.schemeName: Production Incentive / Back-Ended Subsidy for Cultivation of Horticulture Crops
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, the farmers who possess farmer's identity cards / authenticated land records/documents are provided with One-Time Assistance/ Bi‐Annual Assistance/ Annual Assistance for the Cultivation of Horticulture Crops such as Mango, Guava, and Sapota.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Assistance of Capital Investment Subsidy to Micro enterprises
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

fields.schemeName: Construction of Godown for Grain Storage
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 24th December 2013, the scheme "Construction of Warehouse for Grain Storage" by the Panchayat and Rural Development Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh aims to provide modern and scientific food grain storage facilities under Food Security Act 13 to applicants in rural areas.

fields.schemeName: Jharkhand Petrol Subsidy Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Petrol Subsidy Scheme" implemented by the Food, Public Distribution & Consumer Affairs Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide a petrol subsidy of ₹250 per month for two-wheelers to eligible NFSA/Jharkhand State Food Security Scheme beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Gambhir Bimari Upchar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Gambhir Bimari Upchar Yojana" by the Department of Health, Medical Education & Family Welfare, Government of Jharkhand, provides medical grants of up to ₹5,00,000/- for the treatment of critical illnesses and supports acid attack victims.

fields.schemeName: Shaktidoot Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Shaktidoot Scheme", an initiative by the Gujarat Government in 2006, supports talented sportspersons in achieving excellence at national and international levels by providing need-based sports facilities and financial assistance.

fields.schemeName: Junior Research Fellowship In Engineering & Technology
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Junior Research Fellowship in Engineering & Technology" by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education is meant for candidates who wish to pursue research leading to a Ph.D. degree in engineering and technology.

fields.schemeName: National Centre For Communications Security (NCCS) Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The National Centre for Communications Security (NCCS) Internship Scheme allows young talent to be associated with the NCCS work for mutual benefit. It will enable NCCS to interact with young scholars and to get fresh ideas and study/ research support from the field of academics.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Assistance for Saving in Consumption of Energy and Water
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Assistance for Power Connection Charges
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Horticulture Kit to Urban and Rural Areas
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, all the horticulture growers in rural & urban areas are provided with a horticulture kit worth ₹ 3,000 per kit to urban and rural areas, during Aadipattam/Thaipattam, through the Additional Director of Agriculture (Horticulture).

fields.schemeName: Haryana Pre Matric Scholarship For Minority
fields.briefDescription: Launched in June 2006 under the Prime Minister's New 15 Point Programme for the Welfare of Minorities, the "Pre-Matric Scholarship for Students Belonging to the Minority Communities" is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme by the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Government of India.

fields.schemeName: Primary Education Scholarship (Madhya Pradesh)
fields.briefDescription: The "Primary Education Scholarship" scheme provides ₹150/- annually to students from De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic communities who are studying in classes 1st to 5th.  The scholarship distribution is managed through the Directorate of Public Education, Government of Madhya Pradesh.

fields.schemeName: Running of Scheduled Caste Hostel
fields.briefDescription: The "Running of Scheduled Caste Hostels" scheme by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to provide housing and a conducive study environment for Scheduled Caste students. Separate junior, senior, and college hostels are operated for boys & girls.

fields.schemeName: ₹ 5 Lakh Insurance Cover To Farmers
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 15 August 2018, the scheme "₹5 Lakh Insurance Cover for Farmers" is an Insurance Scheme by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Telangana. This scheme provides ₹5 lakh insurance coverage to all farmers aged between 18 and 60 years.

fields.schemeName: Junior Research Fellowship In Sciences, Humanities, And Social Sciences
fields.briefDescription: The scheme of Junior Research Fellowship in Sciences, Humanities, and Social Science by UGC, Dept. of Education, is open to candidates who qualify for the National Eligibility Test-Junior Research Fellowship(NET-JRF) of the UGC and the UGC-Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (UGC-CSIR).

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Free Supply of Textbooks, Stationery, Uniforms and Footwears to Poor Children
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, textbooks, notebooks, Uniforms, dictionaries, stationery, etc. are provided free of cost to all students studying in LKG to 12th Standard of all Government and Government-aided Private Schools. The objective of this scheme is to achieve 100% student enrolment.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Vegetable Seeds Minikit & Fruits Minikit at Free of Cost
fields.briefDescription: “Distribution of Vegetable Seeds Minikit & Fruits Minikit at Free of Cost" was launched by the Dept of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, UT of Puducherry. All the horticulture growers of rural & urban areas are provided with vegetable seeds minikit & fruits minikit worth ₹250/‐ free of cost.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for Assistance to Mega Industries: Reimbursement of Stamp Duty and Registration Fees
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for Assistance to Mega Industries" aims to strengthen the overall industrial ecosystem in the State and also enable a larger set of manufacturing companies to emulate the adoption of clean energy and make them future-ready to compete in global markets.

fields.schemeName: Reservoir Fisheries Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Reservoir Fisheries Development Scheme" by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Jharkhand, enhances fish production and livelihood opportunities for registered fisheries cooperatives through the provision of fish fingerlings, boats, and nets.

fields.schemeName: Sona Sobaran Dhoti Saree Distribution Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Sona Sobaran Dhoti Saree Distribution Scheme" by the Department of Food, Public Distribution and Consumer Affairs, Government of Jharkhand, provides one dhoti/lungi and one saree at a subsidized rate to NFSA and JSFSS beneficiaries to ensure clothing accessibility for low-income families

fields.schemeName: Sugar Distribution Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Sugar Distribution Scheme" by the Department of Food, Public Distribution and Consumer Affairs, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide subsidized sugar to AAY households under NFSA, ensuring access to essential food commodities at affordable rates.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Help Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 02-10-2019, the Chief Minister Help Scheme under the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Madhya Pradesh, provides food distribution and material aid to Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries whose family members are not in government service.

fields.schemeName: AICTE - Scheme For Promoting Interests, Creativity And Ethics Among Students
fields.briefDescription: AICTE-SPICES scheme provides financial support to institutions for developing students' clubs for the well-rounded development of students by promoting their interests, creativity, and ethics. This club should serve as a model for other clubs in the institution and also those in other institutions.

fields.schemeName: Kisan Samriddhi Yojana Jharkhand
fields.briefDescription: The "Kisan Samriddhi Yojana" by the Department of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry & Cooperative, Government of Jharkhand, promotes solar-powered irrigation systems to reduce agricultural costs and dependency on fossil fuels. Farmers receive up to 90% subsidy for solar units under this initiative.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to Large Industries and Thrust Sector: Net SGST Reimbursement
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to Large Industries and Thrust Sector"  aims to provide incentives to attract increased investments in the manufacturing sector to create more employment opportunities in Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to Large Industries and Thrust Sector: Assistance of Interest Subsidy
fields.briefDescription: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to Large Industries and Thrust Sector"  aims to provide incentives to attract increased investments in the manufacturing sector to create more employment opportunities in Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Kerosene Oil Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Distribution of Kerosene Oil Scheme" by the Department of Food, Public Distribution and Consumer Affairs, Government of Jharkhand, supports NFSA beneficiaries and others by providing 1 liter of kerosene oil at subsidized rates.

fields.schemeName: Banglar Awaas Yojana (BAY)
fields.briefDescription: "Banglar Awaas Yojana (BAY)" provides financial assistance to houseless households and those living in kutcha or dilapidated houses, helping them build pucca houses with essential amenities. The scheme offers financial assistance with additional support for toilets and unskilled workdays.

fields.schemeName: Free Bicycle Distribution Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Free Bicycle Distribution Scheme" by the Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide financial aid for bicycle purchases to Scheduled Caste (SC) students studying in Class 8th. Each student receives ₹3000 through DBT.

fields.schemeName: AICTE - Grant For Augmenting Infrastructure In North Eastern Region
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "AICTE - Grant for Augmenting Infrastructure in North Eastern Region (GAINER)" was introduced by AICTE to enhance the functional efficiency of the technical institutes located in far-flung areas of North East India, by addressing deficiencies in water, electricity, and internet.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Awards For Outstanding Services In The Field Of Prevention Of Alcoholism And Substance (Drug) Abuse: Best Integrated Rehabilitation Centre For Addicts (IRCA) For Providing Rehabilitation Services To Alcoholics And Drug Users
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme of "National Awards for Outstanding Services in the field of Prevention of Alcoholism and Substance (Drug) Abuse" by the MoSJE, GoI shall be applicable to Institutions and Individuals working in the field of Prevention of Alcoholism and Substance (Drug) Abuse.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Marriage (HPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The Financial Assistance for Marriage scheme under the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board provides ₹51,000/- for the marriage of a registered unmarried beneficiary and ₹51,000/- per child for the marriage of up to two children of a married beneficiary.

fields.schemeName: Strengthening Skills, Arts and Employment through ITIs
fields.briefDescription: The "Strengthening Skills, Arts, and Employment through ITIs" initiative by the Department of De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic Welfare, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to connect these skills with modern technology, short-term, employment-oriented training has been provided through ITIs.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure: Common Boiler Project by SPV Constituted by Minimum 10 MSMEs
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy aims to provide incentives for environmental compliance to ensure long-term economic and ecological balance.

fields.schemeName: Excellent Work Award Scheme for Social Worker of De-Notified Communities
fields.briefDescription: The "Excellent Work Award Scheme for Social Workers of De-notified Communities" by the Government of Madhya Pradesh awards ₹1,00,000/- to a social worker from De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic communities for outstanding contributions to their social and economic upliftment.

fields.schemeName: Hostel Facility Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The Hostel Facility Scheme, introduced by the HPBOCWWB , provides financial assistance ranging from ₹15,000 to ₹20,000 annually. This support covers accommodation, boarding, and food expenses for the children of registered worker while they reside in a hostel.

fields.schemeName: Gopal Incentive Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Gopal Incentive Scheme" by the Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, promotes the rearing of Indian high-breed cattle and boosts milk production, benefiting animal breeders and livestock farmers with access to Indian advanced breed cows.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Centrally-Sponsored Scheme Of Pre-Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste Students Studying In Classes 9th & 10th
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment for regular, full-time students from Scheduled Castes studying in Class 9th and 10th in a Govt. School / a School recognized by Govt. / CBSE / State Board of Secondary Education.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure: Scheme of Assistance for Strengthening the Regulation and Environmental Compliance
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy aims to provide incentives for environmental compliance to ensure long-term economic and ecological balance.

fields.schemeName: Kishori Balika Yojana (Madhya Pradesh)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Kishori Balika Yojana" by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Madhya Pradesh aims to provide vocational, health, and hygiene training to adolescent girls. Through this scheme, training and material assistance are provided to the girls.

fields.schemeName: INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Rural)
fields.briefDescription: "INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Rural)" scheme aims to disburse monthly pensions to the individuals 18 years or above in age and having a disability of 40% or above. To be eligible, they should be from a BPL family, be a resident of the district, and not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower: Scheme of Financial Assistance for Tuition Fees for Enhancement of Skill
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy aims to bridge the industry’s skill gap, boost employment, and align workforce training with evolving technology and business needs.
